update --help for UDP default

disable UDP port by defaultAs reported UDP amplification attacks have started to use insecureinternet-exposed memcached instances. UDP used to be a lot more popular as atransport for memcached many years ago but I'm not aware of many recentusers.Ten years ago the TCP connection overhead from many clients was relativelyhigh (dozens or hundreds per client server) but these days many clients arebatched or user fewer processes or simply anre't worried about it.While changing the default to listen on localhost only would also help thetrue culprit is UDP. There are many more use cases for using memcached overthe network than there are for using the UDP protocol.

Replace event_init() with new API if detect newer versionIf we detect libevent version >= 2.0.2-alpha change to useevent_base_new_with_config() instead of obsolete event_init() for creating newevent base. Set config flag to EVENT_BASE_FLAG_NOLOCK to avoid lock/unlockaround every libevent operation.For newer version of libevent the event_init() API is deprecated and istotally unsafe for multithreaded use. By using the new API we can explicitlydisable/enable locking on the event_base.
non-issue leak found via static analysis #2issue #338 reported a memory leak in the init code. another non-issue sinceit's a handful of bytes and that code path is only used in a couple of tests.
non-issue leak found via static analysisissue #337 reported a memory leak but in these cases the process exits anyway.
fix gcc warnings

remove redundant counter/lock from hash tablecurr_items tracks how many items are linked in the hash table. internally tothe hash table hash_items tracked how many items were in the hash table.on every insert/delete hash_items had to be locked and checked to see if thtable should be expanded. rip that all out and call a check with theonce-per-second clock event to check for hash table expansion.this actually ends up fixing an obscure bug: if you burst a bunch of setsthen stop the hash table won't attempt to expand a second time until thenext insert. with this change every second the hash table has a chance ofexpanding again.

limit crawls for metadumperLRU crawler metadumper is used for getting snapshot-y looks at the LRU's.Since there's no default limit it'll get any new items added or bumped sincethe roll started.with this change it limits the number of items dumped to the number thatexisted in that LRU when the roll was kicked off. You still end up with anapproximation but not a terrible one:- items bumped after the crawler passes them likely won't be revisited- items bumped before the crawler passes them will likely be visited toward  the end or mixed with new items.- deletes are somewhere in the middle.
extstore: fix segfault in 'extstore' adm commandwould segfault if you gave it only 2 arguments :|
extstore: doc fixesneeds more writing. will happen over time. at least --help has the rightnumber of newlines...
extstore: handle errors in binprot pathI purposefully broke _get_extstore and it turned it into a miss as expected.tests pass with/without extstore.
extstore: fix bad default for free_memchunkswas initializing to 1... but we want it to be zero until the thing has achance to fill and flip on the balancer algo.
extstore: default item_age to UINT_MAXwith page mover algo being less shitty shouldn't rely on item_age except forweird scenarios.

extstore: prefill global page pool with extstorethe slab page mover algo would fill memory to evicting for a few secondsbefore jumping to life and shoveling some pages into the global pool.swore I was going to fix this post-release but I had a moment of inspirationafter finding some code from another branch that did half the work. After abunch of stupid bugs it seems to work.-o slab_automove_freeratio=0.N is now an option. This is *percentage of totalmemory* so don't set it too high.
extstore: wbuf_count shouldn't be configurableneeds to always be == bucket count for a while now so kill option.
extstore: stats settings outputsfinally.
extstore: better error handling for init.can add more later; extremely unlikely to happen.can/should convert more functions to use extstore_err + codes.
fix "slab_automove_window" in stats settings%.f'ing a %u.

extstore: tuning drop_unread semanticsthere's now an optional ext_drop_under setting which defaults to the same ascompact_under which should be fine. now if drop_unread is enabled it onlykicks in if there are no pages matching the compaction threshold.This allows you to set a lower compaction frag rate then start rescuing onlynon-COLD items if storage is too full. You can also compact up to a pointthen allow a buffer of pages to be used before dropping unread.previously enabling drop_unread would always drop_unread even when compactingnormally. This limited utility of the feature.
extstore: close hole with storage trackingitems expired/evicted while pulling from tail weren't being tracked leadingto a leak of object counts in pages.
make -I argument less position dependent-m after -I could cause errors.

extstore: C version of automove algorithmcouple TODO items left for a new issue I thought of. Also hardcoded memorybuffer size which should be fixed.also need to change the "free and re-init" logic to use a boolean in case anyrelated option changes.

extstore: experimental per-class free chunk limitexternal comands only for the moment. allows specifying per-slab-class howmany chunks to leave free before causing flushing to storage.the external page mover algo in previous commits has a few issues:- relies too heavily on page mover. lots of constant activity under load.- adjusting the item age level on the fly is too laggy and can easily  over-frefree or under-free. IE; class 3 has TTL 90 but class 4 has TTL 60and most of the pages in memory it won't free much until it lowers to 60.Thinking this would be something like; % of total chunks in slab class.easiest to set as a percentage of total memory or by write rate periodically.from there TTL can be balanced almost as in the original algorithm; keep asmall global page pool for small items to allocate memory from and pullpages from or balance between storage-capable classes to align TTL.

extstore: "stats extstore" to dump page datadumps some limited data about each page. version bytes in use assignedbucket if any.need to add if it's active or free or closed or etc to make it more useful.

extstore: ext_compact_under to control compactionhad a hardcoded value of "start to compact under a slew if more than 3/4thsof pages are used" but this allows it to be set directly.ie; "I have 100 pages but don't want to compact util almost full and thendrop any unread"

extstore: add ext_drop_unread option + live tunewas struggling to figure out how to automatically turn this on or off but Ithink it should be part of an outside process.ie; a mechanism should be able to target a specific write rate and one ofits tools for reducing the write rate should be flipping this on.there's *still* a hole where you can't trigger a compaction attempt ifthere's no fragmentation. I kind of want if this feature is on to attempta compaction on the oldest page while dropping unread items.
extstore: page mover can decrement storagepage mover didn't have a reference to the storage object so items lostduring page move transitions wouldn't be decremented from storage.

extstore: crawler fix and ext_low_ttl optionLRU crawler was not marking reclaimed expired items as removed from thestorage engine. This could cause fragmentation to persist much longer than itshould but would not cause any problems once compaction started.Adds "ext_low_ttl" option. Items with a remaining expiration age below thisvalue are grouped into special pages. If you have a mixed TTL workload thiswould help prevent low TTL items from causing excess fragmentation/compaction.Pages with low ttl items are excluded from compaction.
extstore: add extstore_limit_maxbytes statwas easy. also kills some comments.
extstore: don't start with UDP supportalso fixes a bug where setting -U 0 would disable TCP automatically...and vice versa.
extstore: make ext_recache_rate=0 workwould divide by zero before :) now short circuits whole function.
extstore: rename _ascii_get_* to just _get_*
extstore: configure and start time gating./configure --enable-extstore to compile the feature inspecify -o ext_path=/whatever to start.
extstore: fix a few more missing ifdefs
extstore: fix binprot miss-from-extstorewas blanking out the entire response when it needs to send a specialresponse.don't *need* to copy the key here since hdr_it is available but should befine.

extstore: minor bugfixesrefuse to start if inline_ascii_resp is enabled due to it breaking the itemheader objects.actually use iovst value passed during binprot requestsmake the item flags converters the same (strtoul can eat leading space). needto replace them with a function still.
extstore: support chunked items.item size max must be <= wbuf_size.reads into iovecs writes out of same iovecs.

extstore: basic binary protocol supportunder high memory pressure the protocol can desync due to a lack of errorhandling code paths in binprot :( But; if that's rare enough this is testable.like ascii incr/decr/append/prepend and chunked items don't presently work.change was tricky but much smaller than I thought it'd be.
extstore: force-disable item chunkingavoid data corruption until they're supported properly.I bet the easiest way is to ensure item_size_max < wbuf size and copy thewhole thing in/out...
extstore: skip unhit objects if full in compactionif < 2 free pages left "evict" objects which haven't been hit at all.should be better than evicting everything if we can continue compacting.

extstore: split write into write_request+writewrite_request returns a buffer to write into which lets us not corrupt theactive item with the hash and crc."technically" we can save 24 bytes per item in storage but I'll leave thatfor a later optimization in case we want to stuff more data into the header.
extstore: block incr/decr/append/prepend on HDR's
external storage base commitbeen squashing reorganizing and pulling code off to go upstream aheadof merging the whole branch.
fix: -o no_lru_crawler didn't work
adds get and touch command for ascii protocol

fix theoretical leak in process_bin_statIf len were to be <= 0 it would not free the dump buffer.As written if dump_buf is not NULL length will have a minimum value of 5 sothat condition can't trigger.Safer to fix the bug though :)Thanks to shqking on github for the report.
-o no_hashexpand to disable hash table expansionlets you specify an exact size and don't try to realloc once running.
fix chunked items set in binprot read from asciioff-by-one was leaving a blank/garbage byte before the \r\n.I look forward to the day of not needing the \r\n to be in the item.
interface code for flash branchremoves a few ifdef's and upstreams small internal interface tweaks for easyrebase.
small refactor on suffixlists for asci get cmdpull out some common code.
don't create hashtables larger than 32bitmost other stats related to items should be 64bit so the totals should beableable to go higher until we get 64bit hash tables.

add max_connections stat to 'stats' outputsince maxbytes is stated twice anyway lets make it easier for monitoringscripts to tell when connections are filling up.Inspired by a PR from thatsafunnyname on github.
Drop sockets from obviously malicious command stringsFor #265
fix null pointer ref in logger for bin update cmdreported by viennadd on github. (SourceBrella Inc)
fix tiny bug in seccomp debug testmissed retval of system call

Add drop_privileges() for LinuxImplement an aggressive version of drop_privileges(). Additionally addsimilar initialization function for threads drop_worker_privileges().This version is similar to Solaris one and prohibits memcached frommaking any not approved syscalls. Current list narrows down the allowedcalls to socket sends/recvs accept epoll handling futex (anddependencies - mmap) getrusage (for stats) and signal / exithandling.Any incorrect behaviour will result in EACCES returned. This should berestricted further to KILL in the future (after more testing).The feature is only tested for i386 and x86_64. It depends on bpffilters and seccomp enabled in the kernel. It also requires libsecompfor abstraction to seccomp filters. All are available since Linux 3.5.Seccomp filtering can be enabled at compile time with --enable-seccomp.In case of local customisations which require more rights memcachedallows disabling drop_privileges() with "-o no_drop_privileges" atstartup.Tests have to run with "-o relaxed_privileges" since they requiredisk access after the tests complete. This adds a few allowed syscallsbut does not disable the protection system completely.
flip defaults and add long options-o -> --extended but some of those options should be top level. can fix infuture iterations.update --help and golf the wordcount a bitadd long options to manpage
sanity check
save four bytes per item if client flags are 0If the size of the flags are 0 it can easily mean to not store anything atall.

hot_max_age is now hot_max_factordefaults at 20% of COLD age.hot_max_age was added because many people's caches were sitting at 32% memoryutilized (exactly the size of hot). Capping the LRU's by percentage and agewould promote some fairness but I made a mistake making WARM dynamic but HOTstatic. This is now fixed.
add a real slab automover algorithmconverts the python script to C more or less.

slab_rebal: delete busy items if stuckif we loop through a slab too many times without freeing everything deleteitems stuck with high refcounts. they should bleed off so long as theconnections aren't jammed holding them.should be possible to force rescues in this case as well but that's more codeso will follow up later. Need a big-ish refactor.
per-LRU hits breakdownno actual speed loss. emulate the slab_stats "get_hits" by totalling up theper-LRU get_hits.could sub-LRU many stats but should use a different command/interface forthat.

fix very old memory leak in ASCII multigetsif using gets/cas or -o modern and a key after the first key is too long (>KEY_MAX_LENGTH) the suffixes used for the previous keys are leaked.hopefully this solves the mystery memory leaks folks have had on and off overthe years...

Spelling fixes* accesses* amount* append* command* cyrillic* daemonize* detaches* detail* documentation* dynamically* enabled* existence* extra* implementations* incoming* increment* initialize* issue* javascript* number* optimization* overall* pipeline* reassign* reclaimed* response* responses* sigabrt* specific* specificity* tidiness

Avoid segfault if idle_timeout value is missing.If memcached is called without a numeric argument for the idle_timeout option so:  -o idle_timeoutand not:  -o idle_timeout=60it segfaults inside stdlib/strtol_l.c:: ____strtol_l_internal from stdlib.h::atoi from the IDLE_TIMEOUT case.I am using glibc-2.12 on RHEL6.  I think atoi(NULL) is undefined behaviour.This change guards against this for the the idle_timeout option in the same manner as the cases that use the subopts_value printing that the numeric argument is missing for the idle_timeout option.

Don't overflow item refcount on getCounts as a miss if the refcount is too high. ASCII multigets are the onlytime refcounts can be held for so long.doing a dirty read of refcount. is aligned.trying to avoid adding an extra refcount branch for all calls of item_get dueto performance. might be able to move it in there after logging refactoringsimplifies some of the branches.

usability fix for cache_memlimitthrows an error if someone asks for a petabyte of RAM (I can't wait for theday this bites me). specify the unit properly in documentation.thanks to @arodland for the report.

fix verbose print for idle-kickersome platforms may have a 64bit useconds_t.. since the maximum value we canpossibly sleep is 100m (1m / (1 / 100)) it's easier to cast explicitly to intfor the print. Otherwise I have to change the format and then always upcast itto 64bit.

refactor chunk chaining for memory efficiencyMemory chunk chains would simply stitch multiple chunks of the highest slabclass together. If your item was 17k and the chunk limit is 16k the itemwould use 32k of space instead of a bit over 17k.This refactor simplifies the slab allocation path and pulls the allocation ofchunks into the upload process. A "large" item gets a small chunk assigned asan object header rather than attempting to inline a slab chunk into a parentchunk. It then gets chunks individually allocated and added into the chainwhile the object uploads.This solves a lot of issues:1) When assembling new potentially very large items we don't have to sit andspin evicting objects all at once. If there are 20 16k chunks in the tail andwe allocate a 1 meg item the new item will evict one of those chunksinbetween each read rather than trying to guess how many loops to run beforegiving up. Very large objects take time to read from the socket anyway.2) Simplifies code around the initial chunk. Originally embedding data intothe top chunk and embedding data at the same time required a good amount offiddling. (Though this might flip back to embedding the initial chunk if I canclean it up a bit more).3) Pulling chunks individually means the slabber code can be flatened to notthink about chunks aside from freeing them which culled a lot of code andremoved branches from a hot path.4) The size of the final chunk is naturally set to the remaining about ofbytes that need to be stored which means chunks from another slab class canbe pulled to "cap off" a large item reducing memory overhead.
update `-o modern` documentation for -h

move temp_ttl command and document LRU command"lru temp_ttl <number>" is now used instead of "temporary_ttl <number>"TEMP_LRU can also be enabled/disabled completely at runtime with this command.Also adds documentation for all options of the "lru" command.
allow TEMP_LRU to work with flat LRU.

Allow switching LRU algo's at runtimeIf LRU maintainer thread is started this allows you to switch between "flat"and "segmented" modes at runtime. The maintainer thread will drain HOT/WARMLRU's if put into flat mode and no new items should fill in.This was much easier than expected...
lru tune command for setting LRU parameters

autotuning for HOT/WARM LRU'sBy default 1/3rd of cache memory can go to HOT and WARM. I've noticed manypeople's caches will shrink to 1/3rd while others may have items sit idle inWARM for many times longer than the size of COLD.This adds another factor for capping the size of each LRU; maximum idle ages.If items sit idle for an hour in HOT they're a good candidate for COLD. Inthe new default WARM items will get twice the idle time of COLD for a chanceto stay in WARM and get hit again.

NOEXP_LRU is now TEMP_LRUConfident the other feature was never used; and if someone wants it it's easyto restore by allowing exptime of 0 to go into TEMP_LRU.This could possibly become a default or at least recommended.

NOEXP_LRU can now act as a "transient" LRUBeen resisting this for a long time due to how HOT operates. However it'sprobably a good way to relieve some pressure off the LRU crawler and do fewercross-LRU juggles.The "NOEXP" LRU can still function by simply setting the transient_ttl to 0(handy!). This is a test so the variables haven't been renamed yet andthere's a perhaps temporary command for live-modification of the transientthreshold.

Do LRU-bumps while already holding item lockitem_get() would hash item_lock fetch item.consumers which can bump the LRU would then call item_update()which would hash item_lock then update the item.Good performance bump by inlining the LRU bump when it's necessary.

reduce add_iov() work for TCP connectionsBack in 2006 memcached's frontend was optimized for primarily UDP traffic. Theextra fiddling for every subsection of a response has persisted since thenwhere most users are TCP. Shortening this function has a large effect onperformance (6%+)
inlined ascii headers now work again with CAS

start time twiddle for inlining ascii responseperformance of GET's is within 8% of inlined. Some further improvements shouldstill be possible. Mixed set/get workload may come out even or ahead in CPUusage.
allow skipping thread-local cache lockssuffix cache was using a generic cache system which uses a mutex lock. thepools are per-thread however.

conditionally don't inline the ASCII VALUE linemissing methods of changing the value. uses what should be a high speed itoainstead of snprintf in a handful of places. Should speed up sets reducememory overhead and ideally not slow down gets too much.
add `-o modern` switches to -hhopefully remembering to update it :P
fix cache_memlimit bug for > 4G valuesThe argument to *_adjust was size_t but the input value being multiplied fromwas a uint so this does the appropriate cast.
log class id with fetchers and mutationsyou can now cross-reference slab classes of evicted prefixes with misses
fix store log and add ttlthe TTL is relative so you won't see the exact TTL on entry. Also fixes twooff-by-one's for the status values.
add logging endpoint for LRU crawlerfor the internal checker primarily.
fix print format for idle timeout threadedited fprintf to use %ul instead of %d

improve binary sasl security fixesWould return errors on empty or minimal password requests.Also potential overflows if you send the second SASL packet with longer itemdata than initally requested.Passes tests but the tests might not have good enough coverage.
Add -X option to disable cachedump/metadumpIn case you're worried about leaking cache contents.
CVE reported by cisco talos
use slab_sizes_unparsed instead of subopts_valuethey're the same but this is more explicit. reported by danial-cao on github.
typo fix in -h's -o modern note.from adamchainz on github.

pull LRU crawler out into its own file.~600 lines gone from items.c makes it a lot more manageable.this change is almost purely moving code around and renaming functions. verylittle logic has changed.

refactor checkpoint for LRU crawlernow has internal module system for the LRU crawler.autocrawl checker should be a bit better now. doesn'tconstantly re-run the histogram calcs.metadump works as a module now. ended up generalizing the client case outsideof the module system since it looks reusable. Cut the amount of functionsrequired for metadump specifically to nothing.still need to bug hunt a few more smaller refactors and see about pullingthis out into its own file.
allow redispatching sidethread conn to workeralso fixes a bug where metadump was closing the client connection after asingle slab class.not ported to the logger yet.
prototype functionality for LRU metadumperFunctionality is nearly all there. A handful of FIXME's and TODO's to address.From there it needs to be refactored into something proper.
remove some dead thread codeis_listen_thread() was removed from service after the new listen sockets wereadded. this removes the rest of the code.

ensure authenticated request bodies for Admin-API (#5984)This commit adds a check to the server's admin-API such that it onlyaccepts Admin-API requests with authenticated bodies. Further thiscommit updates the `madmin` package to always add the`X-Amz-Content-Sha256` header.This change improves the Admin-API security since the server does notaccept unauthenticated request bodies anymore.After this commit `mc` must be updated to the new `madmin` api becauserequests over TLS connections will fail.

security: fix write-to-RAM DoS vulnerability (#5957)This commit fixes a DoS vulnerability for certain APIs usingsignature V4 by verifying the content-md5 and/or content-sha56 ofthe request body in a streaming mode.The issue was caused by reading the entire body of the request intomemory to verify the content-md5 or content-sha56 checksum if present.The vulnerability could be exploited by either replaying a V4 request(in the 15 min time frame) or sending a V4 presigned request with alarge body.

fix DoS vulnerability in request authentication (#5887)This commit fixes a DoS vulnerability in therequest authentication. The root cause is an 'unlimited'read-into-RAM from the request body.Since this read happens before the request authenticationis verified the vulnerability can be exploit without anyaccess privileges.This commit limits the size of the request body to 3 MB.This is about the same size as AWS. The limit seems to bebetween 1.6 and 3.2 MB - depending on the AWS machine whichis handling the request.
Remove s3:ListObjects policy action to be in sync with AWS-S3 (#5875)

Enhance policy handling to support SSE and WORM (#5790)- remove old bucket policy handling- add new policy handling- add new policy handling unit testsThis patch brings support to bucket policy to have more control notlimiting to anonymous.  Bucket owner controls to allow/deny any restAPI.For example server side encryption can be controlled by allowingPUT/GET objects with encryptions including bucket owner.
Create logger package and rename errorIf to LogIf (#5678)Removing message from error loggingReplace errors.Trace with LogIf
Return InvalidDigest when md5 sent by client is invalid (#5654)This is to ensure proper compatibility with AWS S3 handlespecial cases where- Content-Md5 is set to empty- Content-Md5 is set to invalid
Remove unwanted errorIf  calls (#5621)Remove errorIf call with a errSignatureMismatch error
Handle incoming proxy requests ip scheme (#5591)This PR implements functions to get the right ip schemefrom the incoming proxied requests.

fix authentication bypass against Admin-API (#5412)This change fixes an authentication bypass attack against theminio Admin-API. Therefore the Admin-API rejects now all types ofrequests except valid signature V2 and signature V4 requests - thisincludes signature V2/V4 pre-signed requests.Fixes #5411

Allow x-amz-content-sha256 to be optional for PutObject() (#5340)x-amz-content-sha256 can be optional for any AWS signature v4requests make sure to skip sha256 calculation when payloadchecksum is not set.Here is the overall expected behavior** Signed request **- X-Amz-Content-Sha256 is set to 'empty' or some 'value'  or its  not 'UNSIGNED-PAYLOAD'- use it to validate the incoming payload.- X-Amz-Content-Sha256 is set to 'UNSIGNED-PAYLOAD' - skip checksum verification- X-Amz-Content-Sha256 is not set we use emptySHA256** Presigned request **- X-Amz-Content-Sha256 is set to 'empty' or some 'value'  or its  not 'UNSIGNED-PAYLOAD'- use it to validate the incoming payload- X-Amz-Content-Sha256 is set to 'UNSIGNED-PAYLOAD' - skip checksum verification- X-Amz-Content-Sha256 is not set we use 'UNSIGNED-PAYLOAD'Fixes #5339
Remove duplicate http constants (#5367)
Virtual host style S3 requests (#5095)
bucket-policy: Add IPAddress/NotIPAddress conditions support (#4736)

log: Fix printing of signature error request headers. (#4444)The following commit f44f2e341c931222a8f1e3f1e9911dda80bb2dc0fix was incomplete and we still had presigned URLs printingin query strings in wrong fashion.This PR fixes this properly. Avoid double encodingpercent encoded strings such as`s3%!!(MISSING)A(MISSING)`Print properly as json encoded.`s3%3AObjectCreated%3A%2A`
signature-v4: Use sha256("") for calculating canonical request (#4064)

sign/streaming: Content-Encoding is not set in newer aws-java-sdks (#3986)We can't use Content-Encoding to verify if `aws-chunked` is setor not. Just use 'streaming' signature header instead.While this is considered mandatory on the contrary aws-sdk-javadoesn't set this valuehttp://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/API/sigv4-streaming.html```Set the value to aws-chunked.```We will relax it and behave appropriately. Also this PR supportssaving custom encoding after trimming off the `aws-chunked`parameter.Fixes #3983

For streaming signature do not save content-encoding in PutObject() (#3776)Content-Encoding is set to "aws-chunked" which is an S3 specificAPI value which is no meaning for an object. This is how S3behaves as well for a streaming signature uploaded object.

Add aws:Referer condition key support. (#3641)This change implements bucket policy enhancements required to restrict access based on HTTP referer.See https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/example-bucket-policies.html#example-bucket-policies-use-case-4 for more information.Fixes #3540

Add constants for commonly used values. (#3588)This is a consolidation effort avoiding usageof naked strings in codebase. Whenever possibleuse constants which can be repurposed elsewhere.This also fixes `goconst ./...` reported issues.

api: Set appropriate content-type for success/error responses. (#3537)Golang HTTP client automatically detects content-type butfor S3 clients this content-type might be incorrect ormight misbehave.For example:```Content-Type: text/xml; charset=utf-8```Should be```Content-Type: application/xml```Allow this to be set properly.
Have simpler JWT authentication. (#3501)

Cleanup and fixes (#3273)* newRequestID() (previously generateUploadID()) returns string than byte array.* Remove unclear comments and added appropriate comments.* SHA-256 MD5 Hash functions return Hex/Base64 encoded string than byte array.* Remove duplicate MD5 hasher functions.* Rename listObjectsValidateArgs() into validateListObjectsArgs()* Remove repeated auth check code in all bucket request handlers.* Remove abbreviated names in bucket-metadata* Avoid nested if in bucketPolicyMatchStatement()* Use ioutil.ReadFile() instead of os.Open() and ioutil.ReadAll()* Set crossDomainXML as constant.
v4/presign: Fix presign requests when there are more signed headers. (#3222)This fix removes a wrong logic which fails for requests whichhave more signed headers in a presign request.Fixes #3217
sha256: Verify sha256 along with md5sum signature is verified on the request early. (#2813)
signature: Add legacy signature v2 support transparently. (#2811)Add new tests as well.

signature: Region changes should be handled just like AWS. (#2805)- PutBucket happens with 'us-east-1'.- ListBuckets happens with any region.- GetBucketLocation happens with 'us-east-1' and location is returned.
minor cleanup- Reused contains() from utils.go at a couple of places- Cleanup in return statements and boolean checks
server: Move all the top level files into cmd folder. (#2490)This change brings a change which was done for the 'mc'package to allow for clean repo and have a cleanergithub drop in experience.

Simplify the steps to make changes to config.json (#5186)This change introduces following simplified steps to follow during config migration.``` // Steps to move from version N to version N+1 // 1. Add new struct serverConfigVN+1 in config-versions.go // 2. Set configCurrentVersion to "N+1" // 3. Set serverConfigCurrent to serverConfigVN+1 // 4. Add new migration function (ex. func migrateVNToVN+1()) in config-migrate.go // 5. Call migrateVNToVN+1() from migrateConfig() in config-migrate.go // 6. Make changes in config-current_test.go for any test change```
move credentials as separate package (#5115)

posix: Deprecate custom removeAll/mkdirAll implementations. (#4808)Since go1.8 os.RemoveAll and os.MkdirAll both support longpath names i.e UNC path on windows. The code we are carryingwas directly borrowed from `pkg/os` package and doesn't needto be in our repo anymore. As a side affect this alsoaddresses our codecoverage issue.Refer #4658
Simplify credential usage. (#3893)
Remove XL references in public docs to Erasure. (#3725)Ref #3722

Honor envs properly for access and secret key. (#3703)Also changes the behavior of `secretKeyHash` which isnot necessary to be sent over the network each nodehas its own secretKeyHash to validate.Fixes #3696Partial(fix) #3700 (More changes needed with some code cleanup)

jwt: Cache the bcrypt password hash. (#3526)Creds don't require secretKeyHash to be calculatedeverytime cache it instead and re-use.This is an optimization for bcrypt.Relevant results from the benchmark done locally negativevalue means improvement in this scenario.```benchmark                       old ns/op     new ns/op     deltaBenchmarkAuthenticateNode-4     160590992     80125647      -50.11%BenchmarkAuthenticateWeb-4      160556692     80432144      -49.90%benchmark                       old allocs     new allocs     deltaBenchmarkAuthenticateNode-4     87             75             -13.79%BenchmarkAuthenticateWeb-4      87             75             -13.79%benchmark                       old bytes     new bytes     deltaBenchmarkAuthenticateNode-4     15222         9785          -35.72%BenchmarkAuthenticateWeb-4      15222         9785          -35.72%```
Generate and use access/secret keys properly (#3498)
tests: Add auth-handler. (#2721)Fixes #2658

replace all "crypto/sha256" with "github.com/minio/sha256-simd" (#5391)This change replaces all imports of "crypto/sha256" with"github.com/minio/sha256-simd". The sha256-simd packageis faster on ARM64 (NEON instructions) and can take advantageof AVX-512 in certain scenarios.Fixes #5374

Add base64 encoded MD5 output for Hash Reader (#5315)- Use it to send the Content-MD5 header correctly encoded to S3  Gateway- Fixes a bug in PutObject (including anonymous PutObject) and  PutObjectPart with S3 Gateway found when testing with Mint.
Return ErrContentSHA256Mismatch when sha256sum is invalid (#5188)
Set etag properly to calculated value if available (#5106)Fixes #5100

Simplify data verification with HashReader. (#5071)Verify() was being called by caller after the datahas been successfully read after io.EOF. This disconnectionopens a race under concurrent access to such an object.Verification is not necessary outside of Read() callwe can simply just do checksum verification right insideRead() call at io.EOF.This approach simplifies the usage.

Remove redundant `int` casts in map engineThere were a few unnecessary `int` casts when using vector.c functions;as indexing for vector_t was changed from `size_t` to `int ` quite awhile back the casts are just noise now and can disappear.

Fix integer overflow in layer_resize in map_engine.c (#268)* Fix integer overflow in layer_resize in map_engine.cThere's a buffer overflow bug in the function layer_resize. It allocatesa buffer `tilemap` with size `x_size * y_size * sizeof(struct map_tile)`.But it didn't check for integer overflow so if x_size and y_size arevery large it's possible that the buffer size is smaller than neededcausing a buffer overflow later.PoC: `SetLayerSize(0 0x7FFFFFFF 0x7FFFFFFF);`* move malloc to a separate line

Move core of event loop into main.cAs the core of the event loop is shared by a few different componentswith only minor variations (and has gradually been getting morecomplex) it makes most sense to have a single implementation.

Harden Dispatch machinery against reentrancyIf `dispatch_run` happened to be reentered (due to a job callingFlipScreen or MapEngine for instance) the inner call would modify thequeue often causing the outer call to segfault when it attempted to dothe same.  This fixes the bug by detecting when a reentrant call happensand bailing out if so.

Rename a bunch of stuff for consistencyAvoid using "new" in the names of functions that return a structdirectly since they don't need a corresponding free/unref.  Alsorenamed colormatrix_t to color_fx_t to match with the applyColorFXfunction.  The terminology used for this concept in the Sphere 1.xdocumentation seems kind of inconsistent to be honest...
Fix segfault in GetPersonIgnoreList()Somehow I managed to screw up the NULL check here...
Add copyright headers to shared sourcesEven though most of the code in src/shared/ is reusable it was allstill originally written for miniSphere so the project's copyrightapplies regardless.
Remove some #includes from minisphere.hA few of these are fairly specialized so it's better to include themonly where they're actually needed.

Improve FlipScreen() behavior in Sphere v2 codeNow calling FlipScreen() will temporarily change the event loop exitstrategy to Sphere v1 mode until the next proper tick.  This allowsold-fashioned FlipScreen loops to be embedded in Sphere v2 code.I've debated with myself for a long time whether or not to support this;while it would have been a massive footgun when the engine was usinglongjmp to skip the event loop things are a lot more graceful now.
Refactor/clean up a few minor thingsLocalized the shutdown flag handling to the inside of the event loop.Hopefully this will help prevent mishandling it in the future...
Remove dead code in screenshot handlingI'm not sure what this code was originally meant to be doing but it's acomplete no-op and doesn't need to exist anymore.
Fix more Linux/macOS compile warningsClang in particular is incredibly picky.  It also seems that I somehowmissed a bunch of assignment expressions in the last commit...
Fix a bunch of warnings in Linux buildsThe Linux GCC build has been lousy with warnings for quite a while.Might as well get to work fixing some of them...

Make Dispatch job creation during shutdown an errorCalling functions like Dispatch.onUpdate() during exit handling will nowthrow an error; previously doing this would softlock the engine as thenew job kept the secondary event loop alive without ever actuallyrunning.

Make window-close more graceful for Sv2Games using the main Pegasus event loop are expected to be well-behavedso we shouldn't have to force the issue by disabling JS execution.  Theexit strategy now is more or less the same one used by`Sphere.shutDown()`--cancel update and render jobs but allow promises tosettle before winding down naturally.To retain compatibility with Sphere v1 the original `jsal_disable()`strategy will still be used if the window is closed before the eventloop starts.Fixes #254.
Emphasize "Uncaught Exception" in SSjDespite being highlighted in red the "uncaught:" text still tended toget lost in a sea of "log:" lines.  Now it's all-caps and almostimpossible to miss.

Avoid ever running JS code during a screen flipThis is a relic of the original Sphere 1.x-like architecture and hasproven to be a major source of bugs.  Now that Sphere has a proper eventloop it'd be best to ensure JS execution can only be scheduled fromthere.
Update copyright date to 2018Another year come and gone... another year closer to the pigopocalypse.:pig_nose:  :boom:
Ignore Y offset in person draw order sortingThis allows SetPersonYOffset() to be used to implement e.g. characterjumping without inadvertantly changing the Z-order.

Fix Exit() not closing the engineExit() is now implemented by disabling execution on the Chakra runtimewhich causes uncatchable errors to be thrown out of any JavaScript code;however because MapEngine() runs its own event loop that wasn't beingchecked for and so the map kept being updated indefinitely.  This fixesit.

Fix map engine spriteset subpixel bugSprites residing at subpixel positions were being interpolated by theGPU causing pixels from adjacent sprites to creep in and leave weirdartifacts.  Fixed by doing trunc() on the X/Y before drawing the sprite.
Add [Symbol.iterator] for RNGThis allows RNG objects to be queried with from().  Also fixedDirectoryStream in Cell which was missing dispose().

Fix import() not keeping event loop aliveDepending on the circumstances an awaited import() could cause theevent loop to terminate prematurely if no other jobs were pending asmodule loading doesn't go through the Dispatch queue.  An additionalclause in the event loop exit condition is enough to fix it.Also took the liberty of doing some more refactoring renaming async.cto dispatch.c in the process.
Move Dispatch handling out of screen.cDispatch jobs are better triggered directly from event loop code.`screen_t` should only be responsible for presentation.
Fix Pact "not a promise" errorgetHandler() was called with only the promise instead of the pact *and*the promise.  `pact instanceof Promise` doesn't work so well. :o)

Align small maps to top-left instead of centeringPinning tiny maps to the top-left of the screen isn't as aestheticallypleasing as centering them but considering the existence ofSetRenderScript() and similar functions any other alignment thantop-left is technically a breaking change.

Show function names in SSj backtraceI thought this wasn't going to be implementable due to a bug inChakraCore's debugging API but it was still possible thankfully--Ijust wasn't thinking creatively enough.

Improve internal UTF-8 handlingAmong other things the UTF-8 BOM wasn't handled properly in contextswhere it mattered (FS.readFile() for instance) and CP1252 conversionswere being done in Sphere v2 contexts which is a big no-no.

Add more JSAL stack primitivesJSAL's almost ready for prime time!  There are a few more kinks to workout most notably I'm going to have to simulate Duktape's longjmp()throw model but then it'll just be a matter of slotting in JSAL callswhere the Duktape ones were before.
Fix Sphere v1 relative path computationRelative path computation is now under the purview of SphereFS as wellwhich is just as well now that FS.relativePath() is a thing.Fixes #217.
Fix SphereFS prefix in v1 Spriteset#filenameThis broke some Sphere v1 code that assumed the filename was implicitlyrelative to `@/`.

Explain why backbuffer isn't cleared in map engineI'm the only maintainer right now but in the future if more people signon this should hopefully prevent a well-meaning developer from tryingto "fix" the bug.  The comment makes it very clear that the(mis)behavior is intentional.

Reorder file_read/write() parametersI wanted to do this before but decided to hold off until after 4.8.0was released since it required touching low-level file-loading code.Particularly swapping the count and size parameters is just asking forbugs and I didn't want to risk it so close to a release.
Add license to miniSphere source filesThis really should have been done a long time ago.  I blame it on a badcase of lazishna.

Avoid backbuffer clear in map engine loopFun fact: Sphere 1.x's map engine implementation doesn't clear thebackbuffer between frames unless you explicitly call FlipScreen().  Inreality this is a bug but a lot of existing menu code apparently relieson it so... well here we are.

Rename game_canonicalize() againNow it's called game_build_path().  I think that's about as clear as Ican make it.  Canonicalize was kind of technical-sounding and didn'treally communicate its actual purpose which is to build a full SphereFSpath from a filename passed in by the user.

Remove global variables for screen sizeOne problem with global variables is that they end up being promiscuous:it's just so convenient to access them that you don't think twice aboutusing one's value.  Having to retrieve the value with a function calldoes make you think about whether you really need it or not.  More oftenthan not you don't.

Remove base_dir from all internal FS functionsFile and directory names passed in from the API are always canonicalizedfirst so it's enough just to use a filename internally.  Base directoryhandling is already taken care of by the canonicalizer.Fixes #207.

Remove trailing spaces from C sourcesVisual Studio has a very bad habit of adding phantom tabs at thebeginning of blank lines to match the indent level *despite* supportingvirtual space in the IDE itself up to the surrounding indent level.I've known about the problem for a while but have been too lazy to fixall the sources as per usual.I also documented the specific behavior of FS.createDirectory().  I cansay from experience that it's never really obvious what happens whenattempting to create a directory that already exists so I thought itwas best to explicitly lay out the behavior in the documentation.

Rename all refcounted *_free() to *_unref()This makes it clear at the time an object is unref'd that the call mayor may not free it.  Before "free" was used for both refcounted andnon-refcounted objects leading to a few bugs in the past where objectsgot freed prematurely thanks to me not realizing they weren't referencecounted.

Rename fs_*() functions to game_*()This makes it clearer what's going on.  Each game object is associatedwith a game manifest so let's just say the object represents a gameinstance and be done with it. :o)

Refactor SphereFS implementationWhenever I introduce brand-new things I always want to incorporate thename into the code somehow making it read like a commercial at timesand making it much more difficult to rename things later.  In this casetagging everything "sfs" was unnecessary.  Just "fs" is sufficient.
Alphabetize Sphere v1 API stubsI'm a serious glutton for punishment aren't I?  This was incrediblytedious and annoying but my OCD demanded it must be done.

Refactor a bunch of stuffI honestly lost track of all the changes I made here.  Just a bunch ofgeneral cleanup I guess.  I did centralize the system.ini handling tomake it easier to factor that out if I ever decide to drop support forSphere v1.  That's unlikely to happen any time soon though. :o)

Move Map Engine API into vanilla.cThis completes the long tedious process of isolating the map enginefrom Duktape specifics.  `vanilla.c` is now nearly 280KB more thandouble the size of `pegasus.c`.  The Sphere v1 API is absolutelyginormous!
Add more map engine hooksThere's still a ways to go I think but map_engine.c is finally startingto look like it belongs with the rest of the codebase. :o)
Fix variable policy in map engine API stubsI should do this for everything in vanilla.c too but that's a task foranother day.  This map engine refactoring needs to get done first.

Refactor script activation in map engineThe map engine is structured even more poorly than I thought.  The coderepeats itself way more often than it has any right to.  This was justasking for regressions; I think the only thing that's saved me is thatI've barely touched the map engine code at all since I got everythingworking.
Add more map helper functionsI seem to have my work cut out for me...

Add some Trigger management functionsThe amount of actual work I do in the map engine API stubs is unreal.It's definitely no secret that the map engine was put together in arush; it's a wonder the thing is as stable as it is really.

Continue Map Engine refactoring projectPaying off this much technical debt all at once is not very much funbut it needs to be done.  The rest of the engine is very well organizedbut the map engine is pretty much a bunch of spaghetti because I keptputting off refactoring it.

Start refactoring map_engine.cThe API layer should consist almost entirely of stubs with the realcode to implement the functionality elsewhere.  In large part this isalready the case--except for the map engine.  Many of the API stubsaccess internal map engine variables directly which makes it impossibleto separate them from the map engine proper.  So it seems a nicerefactoring session is in order here...

Clean up after Map Engine/Persons mergerI realized while doing this that a lot of the necessary hooks foraccessing the map engine from outside were already in place I justdidn't have prototypes for them in the header.  This is an advantage ofthe current naming convention it's easy to see at a glance what'smissing on a per-component basis.

Fix Unix build (possibly) after map/person mergerApparently GCC doesn't like it if you refer to a struct in a parameterlist before it's declared.  It considers the declaration in theprototype to be a different type.  Kind of dumb.

Merge code in map_engine.c and person.cThe Sphere v1 map engine design makes it impossible to isolate theentity subsystem from the map engine so it makes more sense for them tobe merged into one module.

Rename Person functions for consistencyThis should make it easier to take stock of what's missing once I go tomove the API functions out of persons.c.  At some point I'll have to dothe same thing with the map engine functions too but one thing at atime.

Remove Sphere 1.x path support from Cellfs_make_path() was copied over from miniSphere and for whatever reasonI never removed the code to handle legacy Sphere 1.x paths.  No sensekeeping it around: Cell has always been a SphereFS platform.
Rename obsmap.c to obstruction.cI've found that sometimes people get confused about what an "obsmap" isso naming the file obstruction.c should hopefully serve as a hint towhat its purpose is.

Refactor main.c a bitFor example renaming delay() to sphere_sleep().  This is closer to theway other internal APIs are structured.  I like this naming schemebecause it makes it easier to find things with IntelliSense.

Do some miscellaneous minor refactorsJust renamed some functions here and there to try to weed out theremaining vestiges of the engine's early development.  The map engine isgoing to be fun to refactor though.  It exposes way too many internaldetails and I'm not sure I'm ready to tackle that yet.

Refactor internal Spriteset objectspriteset.c contained some of the oldest code in the engine.  It was oneof the first parts of the engine I developed and the code has barelybeen touched since then.  I figured now was a good time to overhaul itas part of implementing Sphere 1.x-compatible spriteset handling.There might still be bugs in this implementation; more testing will beneeded before this makes it into a release.
Add Prim.blitSection() to changelogAlso clarified a few entries that seemed a little ambiguous/confusing.
Implement ExecuteZoneScript()I wasn't aware this function even existed until now.  Apparently nogames ever used it.  Not even Lithonite which is surprising.

Remove HashFromString() APII thought Sphere 1.x had this function (by analogy with HashByteArray())but it turns out it never did.  The v1 API is deprecated so there's nosense adding enhancements to it.
Fix GetLayerName being undefinedI implemented the function but apparently forgot to actually registerit for use in JS.

Fix update/render orderIf one quickly glances at the Sphere 1.x MapEngine() loop it seems likethe render script should be called first then the update script.  Butthanks to a quirk of Sphere's frame-skipping logic the first framealways gets skipped and thus in practice the update script is calledfirst.  A few old games actually depend on this and break outright ifthe render script is ever called first--which is usually the case due tominiSphere's better frameskipping algorithm.This fixes the bug by always calling the update script first.

Reorganize project rename Color propertiesSource directories are now named according to the names of the tools sodebugger->ssj compiler->cell etc.Color properties have been renamed back to "red" "green" "blue" and"alpha" as the full names are easier to understand for the uninitiated.

Reorganize source codeI switched to more generic project and subdirectory names to make iteasier to change the names of programs if needed in the future (forexample for the eventual Sphere 2.0 overhaul).
Add new ColorMatrix implementationI may not keep this though I think I can piggyback on Allegro'stransformation API to implement color matrices in hardware using GLSLshaders.

Improve naming of Audialis methodsNow audialis.c follows the current naming convention of object_method.For the most part as much as I fought this in the project's earlystages it does make for more readable code.  Live and learn I suppose?
Remove redundant `extern` modifiersI wanted to do this a while ago but you know laziness and all...
Revert to original map render methodIt seems I didn't give Allegro's sprite batcher enough credit thismethod is actually faster than the "new and improved" Galileo method!

Refactor map Group managementSince render groups are 1:1 with map layers it didn't really make sensetracking them separately.  Shows how long it's been since I touched themap code forgetting there was an existing layer array!
Use bitmap hold when drawing map personsThis allows Allegro to batch-draw persons using the same spritesetwhich potentially improves performance on maps containing many similarobjects.

Fix map engine performance regressionFor large maps with a lot of animated tiles it quickly becomesexpensive to re-upload vertices every frame.  I worked around this bymaintaining two tile atlases: The second is used for actual maprendering and is modified whenever a tile animates.

Render map tiles using GalileoVertices for map tiles on each layer are precalculated and uploaded tothe GPU ahead of time using a Galileo shape object.  This improves maprendering performance particularly at higher resolutions.

Implement SetLayerWidth/Height()Either I missed these in my original review of the Sphere API or I justdidn't see the use at the time.  In any case with this change it's nowpossible to resize map layers at runtime.  As with other changes to mapstructures the change only lasts until the next ChangeMap().
Use backticks for logging filenamesThis makes them easier to pick out in console entries and helps break upthe "wall of text" feeling at higher log levels.
Make MapEngine() framerate optionalNow uses the framerate set by SetFrameRate() by default.  This is morefriendly when using the map engine in combination with miniRT.
Fix require() module search pathrequire() was incorrectly giving preference to system modules.  Thecorrect behavior is to use a game-local module first if one is present.

Strengthen `screen_t` abstractionThe main implementation of FlipScreen() along with frame counting andother related logic has been moved into screen.c.  This allowed me toget rid of a bunch of global and static variables that had no right toexist.

Add option to accept absolute pathsI actually don't need this right now.  I thought I would forExecuteGame() but it turns out that doesn't even use SphereFS routinesso it already does accept an absolute path.  Oh well!

Enhance Assert() behaviorFailing assertions are completely ignored with no debugger attached(although minisphere Console still logs them).  If SSJ _is_ attached andthe user chooses not to continue execution the engine now calls`duk_debugger_pause()` to halt at the point of the failed assertion.

Make RNG functions non-enumerableAs the RNG object is merely used as a namespace and has no underlyingconstructor or prototype the functions are registered differently andweren't affected by the recent visibility change.
Use all lowercase for minisphere log entriesYou wouldn't think so but not logging in sentence case makes a detailedlog much easier to read!
Fix leaked default map and person scriptsTurns out I misread the code and I really _was_ leaking these - only theper-map and per-person scripts were freed not the global "default"ones.

Fix a couple more leaks in minisphere and SSJFile handles were being leaked in SSJ's source code loader (which mayexplain why sometimes source was failing to load come to think ofit...).minisphere was leaking the map update and render scripts.  It'sapparently leaking the default map and person scripts as well but forthe life of me I can't understand how. I checked the code they'reclearly being freed on shutdown.

Fix a bunch of memory leaks in minisphereMostly leakage of paths and lstrings as usual.  Valgrind also says I'mleaking the display which doesn't make much sense--best I can tellshutdown_engine() is always called and unconditionally callsal_destroy_display()...

Reorganize source treeAll sources have been moved into src/.  Any code shared between projects(for example Duktape and Dyad) are now in src/shared instead of being"borrowed" from the engine's directory.This will break the build on Windows. I'll fix it in the next commit.
No longer need to insert write barriers for fibers.Those barriers are inserted to fix #3699 but all living fibers aremarked from `mark_context()` anyway now.
The #3871 fix caused wrong `break from proc-closure` error; fix #3996
Add `fallthrough` comment to silence gcc warning.
Silence gcc initializer warning.
Check length of env stack before accessing upvar; fix #3995
Adjust environment when `mrb_exec_irep` happened.
Need to keep block argument in `mrb_exec_irep`; fix #3973
Needed to set `ci->proc` in `OP_SUPER`; fix #3966
Check `ensure` proc is NULL before calling; fix #3943
Need not to pop `callinfo` on `OP_STOP`.
`super` should raise `TypeError` when the receiver is switched; fix #3911The receiver can be switched using `#instance_eval` etc.
Avoid infinite recursion in `method_missing`; ref #3908
May need more stack space in `mrb_funcall_with_block`; fix #3908
Should not overwrite `ci->target_class` in `mrb_exec_irep()`.For example the following code behaved wrong:```rubyObject.instance_exec(123){|*a|  def foo    42  end}p foo()```

Fixed method look-up for `method_missing` in OP_SUPER; ref #3905Method look-up for `OP_SUPER` should start from the superclass ofthe `target_class` but if it fails the look-up for `method_missing`should start from the class of the receiver.The following code explains the case:```rubyclass Bar  def foo    super  endendclass Foo<Bar  def method_missing(mid *)    p mid  endend```Foo.new.foo

The superclass info should be taken from `TARGET_CLASS(ci->proc).Not from `ci->target_class` that may be switched using `class_eval` etc.fix #3899 fix #3906We found out there is a mruby specific limitation that `super` may bescrewed up when a method is defined in a module and `super` is calledin the block with the target class switched (for example `super` in`class_eval` block).  Now we raise `RuntimeError` for such cases.The following code works in CRuby but not in mruby.```module M  def foo    "aaa".singleton_class.class_eval{super 2}  endendclass Foo  def foo(*); endendclass Bar<Foo  include MendBar.new.foo```
Need to set `ci->proc` before calling methods; fix #3902
Need to clear exception handler on `return`; fix #3898
Retrieve operands at the beginning of `OP_SCLASS`.
Cancel df3507660 that does not do any good.
Avoid updating to reallocated stack in `OP_RETURN`; fix #3870The code was introduced to address #3175 but it's no longer needed.
The `ci` should not be equal to `cibase` with `OP_R_BREAK`; #3871
The proc with top-level env must be 'proc-closure'; fix #3871
Limit `ecall()` depth to 32 (default).
Need to set `ci->proc` when we have `RProc` structure.Mentioned in https://qiita.com/bamchoh/items/eabebbbb330cb0e0470a
Need to unshare env stack on `break`; fix #3866
Check if `ci->proc` is not `NULL` and `MRB_PROC_CFUNC_P()`; fix #3867
The stack shift width should be determined by `p->upper`; fix #3864And check required register number from `ci->proc` as well.The fixes for #3859 and #3862 were incomplete.
Avoid calling `mrb_env_unshare()` when `env` is `NULL`.Small performance improvement by reducing function invocations.
Avoid double free() of env stack; fix #3860Should turn on `MRB_ENV_STACK_UNSHARED` flag only after env stackreallocation.  `malloc()` may fail.
Wrong stack adjustment in `ecall()` (f35f975 #3859); fix #3862
Clear `c->prev` on fiber termination.
Set `MRB_FIBER_TERMINATED` flag on exception termination of a fiber.
Call all ensure clauses pushed at `OP_STOP`.
No need to use `ecall_adjust()`.
Fixed stack address adjustment in `ecall()`; fix #3859
Need to evaluate ensure clauses at fiber termination.
Remove unnecessary code; ref #3711
Stack adjustment should be based on `p->upper`; fix #3857It used to be based on `ci->proc` but the callinfo position may bewrong when `ecall()` is called during stack rewinding from `OP_RETURN`.
Clear ensure stack after calling in `OP_EPOP`; #3855 3856
No need to pop ensure stack if `eidx` is smaller than `epos`; #3855 #3856
fixup! Remove fixed argument of `ecall()`; ref #3855 #3856
Remove fixed argument of `ecall()`; ref #3855 #3856

Reduce the size of `struct RBreak` to reduce memory usage.The old size of `struct RBreak` was 56 bytes (`MRB_NO_BOXING`)and it's bigger than other object structures. That increase thesize of `RVALUE` thus increase the total amount of memory consumption.

Add `MRB_METHOD_TABLE_INLINE` option.Now the method tables (in classes/modules and caches) keeps C functionpointers without wrapping in `struct RProc` objects. For the sake ofportability `mrb_method_t` is represented by the struct and union butif the most significant bit of the pointer is not used by the platform`mrb_method_t` should be packed in `uintptr_t` to reduce memory usage.`MRB_METHOD_TABLE_INLINE` is turned on by default for linux.
Assign operands to local variables.
Need to save stack space by number of registers from the current procNot from the execution ensure proc; fix #3849
Fixed wrong stack extend size; fix #3847
Need to clear stack region for local variables in eval; fix #3844

Use proper target_class to define class/module; fix #3843The outer class of the class/module definition should be taken from`MRB_TARGET_CLASS(mrb->c->ci->proc)` not `mrb->c->ci->target_class`which is the target of constant lookups.
Merge branch 'mrb_without_float' of https://github.com/pandax381/mruby into pandax381-mrb_without_float

Reimplement `block_given?`; ref #3841Make `block_given?` to search for the top of the scope first.The top of the scope means either:* the top method body* the enclosing class body* the top-levelThe special case is the method defined by `define_method` with ablock as in #3841. In cases like this the method body (given bya block) is not considered as the top of the scope. You need to use`&block` in the block parameter if you want to know if a block isgiven to the method.This commit also changes the behavior of `MRB_PROC_SCOPE` flag.Now it is only set if the `proc` is either a class body or a methodbody defined in Ruby. It is no longer set for a block that given to`define_method`.
Merge branch 'master' of github.com:mruby/mruby

Always check division-by-zero to avoid undefined behavior; fix #3816Also removed the code to normalize NaN value for `MRB_NAN_BOXING`.Tha code was added to fix #1712 but no longer required after 249f05e7d.
Call stack may not reference the destination `proc`; fix #3838The destination `proc` may be an orphan.
Removed a debug printf; fix #3834
Remove one of the lines that did the same thing; fix #3836The change is suggested by `ukrainskiysergey` in #3836.I deleted the other line for clarity. I also updated comment lines.
Should clear ensure stack at `OP_RETURN break`; #3715This is a resurrection of d0a7e01 which is accidentallyremoved by 93f5f22; Fix #3715
Should check if `callinfo` stack is popped before updating the stack.This is a resurrection of 75c374c which is accidentally removed by93f5f22; Fix #3507 #3512 #3518 #3521
Fixed UPVAR gotchas; fix #3835Both `uvenv` function and `env` generation in `create_proc_from_string`function have bugs to handling enclosed environment objects.
Remove a debug variable

Heavily refactored how lexical scope links are implemented; fix #3821Instead of `irep` links we added a `upper` link to `struct RProc`.To make a space for the `upper` link we moved `target_class` reference.If a `Proc` does not have `env` `target_class` is saved in an `union`shared with `env` (if a `Proc` has env you can tell it by `MRB_PROC_ENV_P()).Otherwise `target_class` is referenced from `env->c`. We removed linksin `env` as well.This change removes 2 members from `mrb_irep` struct thus saving 2words per method/proc/block. This also fixes potential memory leaksdue to the circular references caused by a link from `mrb_irep`.
Remove MRB_API from `mrb_env_unshare()`
Add MRB_WITHOUT_FLOAT

The first instruction was skipped mistakenly in ensure clause; fix #3811
`OP_EPOP` operand may be bigger than `mrb->c->eidx`; fix #3810
Remove temporary limitation of `OP_EPOP`.After f68f5f6 the operand of `OP_EPOP` should have been `1`.Now we have removed the limitation.
The callinfo stack may be reallocated in `cipush`; fix rest of #3809fix #3809
The ensure stack may be empty at `OP_EPOP`; fix 1st part of #3809
Avoid crossing C function boundary from `OP_EPOP`; ref #3789

Restructure `irep->outer` chain; fix #3804Instead of `irep -> proc` chain we use `irep -> irep` chain toavoid GC bugs like #3804. We added `target_class` reference to`mrb_irep` struct. That means one more word consumption per `irep`.
Fixed a critical typo; ref #3798
Need to update `ci` after `callinfo` stack reallocation; fix #3796
Silence compiler warning regarding float condition; fix #3790
Asserted bidx < ci->nregs for OP_SEND and OP_SUPER
Separate `mrb_str_buf_new` and `mrb_str_new_capa`.`mrb_str_buf_new` is an old function that ensures capacity size of`MRB_STR_BUF_MIN_SIZE` minimum. Usually one need to use`mrb_str_new_capa` instead.
Reset ci in OP_SUPER after potential realloc
Reintroduced not storing converted proc directly in the stack

Removed unneeded ci->nregs checks in OP_SEND and OP_SUPERBecause of #3504 `ci->nregs = bidx+1` was introduced in b64f08784cc50861dec80c26fce715982c02c9e9.This led to the follow up error #3551 whose fix introduced the `if (bidx >= ci->nregs)`check in 071164b7999d0932fd60fb3c580a6c374ab1cf4f and the `stack_extend(mrb ci->nregs)`in 93d802987e722444d0520a8d3f28002841c4f825.Then the code causing #3504 reappeared again in #3590. The fix for it moved the codedealing with the block in OP_SUPER from below the `cipush`  to above the `cipush`in d9fb8b69b0621e8cd2c7c43fd8511a83718d7e45. The `if (bidx >= ci->nregs) { ... }` fromthen on works with the original callinfo and not the pushed one. `ci->nregs` needed tobe modified for the pushed one because it is initialized to 0. But for the original ciit is propertly set and a check is not needed.
Extended stack always based on ci->nregs
Refactored variable usage in OP_SEND and OP_SUPER
Remove some empty lines; ref #3778
Refactored OP_SEND and OP_SUPER and calculate argc right at the top
Defer `mid` update after `unshift`; ref #3776

Silence integer type conversion warnings.
Fixed calling missing method through super with 126 args
Replaced tabs with spaces

The block argument offset saved in the env was wrong; fix #3768When the method takes variable number of argument (`argc = -1`)the block argument offset should be `-1` not `0`.
Float values divided by zero should honor signs; fix #3766It also fixes unexpected resurrection of #3745 by #3752
`mrb_io_initialize_copy` should not free existing `fptr`; fix #4005When arguments `copy` and `orig` are the same object.
`mrb_dup()` should fail if `fd` is a negative integer; ref #4005

Add 'mrbgems/mruby-io/' from commit '3c8e1f94c44252c836f79a48bb17726da28e2756'git-subtree-dir: mrbgems/mruby-iogit-subtree-mainline: 10ed730e4bd921cf4d8fe6f6d2e3cb3f0840f3b7git-subtree-split: 3c8e1f94c44252c836f79a48bb17726da28e2756
Implement NPNVdocumentOriginNo one implements it yet but it's a very simple variable and very veryimportant to support when it does get used.
Remove some spurious debug statements

Another massive commitMaintain and send the owning NPP for every viewer-owned NPObject. Usethis as the NPP when creating proxy objects. Also send an explicitNPObject type so we don't infer which side owns it from ourdictionaries.This fixes the Firefox thing properly.
Go back to calling NPN_CreateObjectWe'll later properly fix this under Firefox so that we pass the real NPPto NPN_CreateObject.
Implement pass-ref semantics for NPObject and NPVariantThis will allow us to get rid of delayed NPN_ReleaseObject.

Handle NPObject lifetime betterAll received NPObjects must be released either directly or by releasingthe NPVariant. Verified that visiting and leaving pages on YouTube andHulu do not leak stubs and proxies.

First iteration of completely rewritten NPObject marshalling codeMost of the credit goes to Chromium as this is the exact same design.The main advantage is that we should no longer be leaking NPObject stubsleft and right.

Pull in NPAPI SDK changes for DOM cursor controlAlso update our code to support this variable and the change incapitalization of NPPVsupportsAdvancedKeyHandling. No NPAPI version bumpor additional hooks are required to support DOM cursor control.
Support all the new variables added
Pull over a new set of NPAPI headers from npapi-sdkFrom http://code.google.com/p/npapi-sdk/. Adjust the code to compilewith the new version.
Kill npw_asprintfIt's not used anywhere and glib provides g_strdup_printf anyway.
Add strings for NPP_ClearSiteData error codes
Print out the NPWindowType we receiveProbably not strictly necessary as we can tell by whether window->windowis NULL. Still useful bit of debug.
Implement string_of_NPNURLVariable

nspluginwrapper-1.2.0Taken from Ubuntu orig.tar.gz file.
nspluginwrapper-1.1.10Taken from Ubuntu orig.tar.gz file.

Hard-code NPNVsupportsAdvancedKeyHandling to FALSEIn case a plugin attempts to check this (unlikely as no browserimplements it yet) and avoid NULL checks on all the entry points weshouldn't crash. Also for correctness even if the browser supports ita browser + nspluginwrapper combination doesn't.
Add missing NULL check
Use g_main_context_add_poll for the RPC sourceThere is not much point in playing silly games with the FD list when wecould just as well add a FD and check it out-of-band.
Rename a variable to be less confusing
Use g_renew instead of freeing and reusing the memory

Fix crash when the number of file descriptors grows and then shrinksThis is a bit of an embarrassing bug. The allocated size of the arrayand the number of elements are not always the same.Reported by Fridtjof Busse.

Implement NPAPI ClearSiteData hooksNow that recent stable versions of Firefox Chrome and Flash allimplement it we should wrap it.Tested in Flash 10.3 with Chrome's 'Clear Browsing Data' Firefox's'Clear Recent History' and Firefox's 'Forget About This Site'. Itappears Flash ignores maxAge and when asked to clear all data eversometimes gives NPERR_GENERIC_ERROR. But those aren't problems on ourend and it seems to otherwise work.See bug #6.
Pass the version to NP_Initialize in NPPluginFuncsFlash 10.3 expects to find a version in there.
Always provide the event loop functionsIt doesn't matter whether or not the browser handles them we always do.
security fixes (#1519)

Highway to PSR2PSR2 rules fully expanded into phpcs.xml with all errors commented out and marked as fixable or as targets for warnings.Removing `?>` from files with only php"There MUST NOT be trailing whitespace at the end of non-blank lines."When present there MUST be one blank line after the namespace declaration.When present all use declarations MUST go after the namespace declaration.There MUST be one use keyword per declaration.There MUST be one blank line after the use block.The extends and implements keywords MUST be declared on the same line as the class name.The opening brace for the class go MUST go on its own line; the closing brace for the class MUST go on the next line after the body.Lists of implements MAY be split across multiple lines where each subsequent line is indented once. When doing so the first item in the list MUST be on the next line and there MUST be only one interface per line.Visibility MUST be declared on all methods.method visibility precedes static keyword and follows abstract keyword(Mostly removing extra lines before closing braces in methods.)Method names MUST NOT be declared with a space after the method name.The opening brace MUST go on its own line and the closing brace MUST go on the next line following the body.There MUST NOT be a space after the opening parenthesis and there MUST NOT be a space before the closing parenthesis.In the argument list there MUST NOT be a space before each comma and there MUST be one space after each comma.When making a method or function call there MUST NOT be a space between the method or function name and the opening parenthesis there MUST NOT be a space after the opening parenthesis and there MUST NOT be a space before the closing parenthesis.In the argument list there MUST NOT be a space before each comma and there MUST be one space after each comma. (**MOSTLY THIS**)Argument lists MAY be split across multiple lines where each subsequent line is indented once. When doing so the first item in the list MUST be on the next line and there MUST be only one argument per line.Argument lists MAY be split across multiple lines where each subsequent line is indented once. When doing so the first item in the list MUST be on the next line and there MUST be only one argument per line.There MUST be one space after the control structure keyword There MUST NOT be a space after the opening parenthesis There MUST NOT be a space before the closing parenthesis There MUST be one space between the closing parenthesis and the opening brace The structure body MUST be indented once The closing brace MUST be on the next line after the bodyThe body of each structure MUST be enclosed by braces. **No inline control structures**The case statement MUST be indented once from switch and the break keyword (or other terminating keyword) MUST be indented at the same level as the case body.There MUST be a comment such as // no break when fall-through is intentional in a non-empty case body.Added scope indentation rules. About 50 files needed manual fixes therefore **this commit needs manual inspection and testing**.Additionally adds foreach rules.Running CI with updated phpcs. Had to disable ScopeClosingBrace rule

ERA handling is modified.1)The automatic forwarding to the next level of insuranceafter the ERA payment is added.2)Also the claim denial code is stored in database for display later.For the first case there is no need to bill again to the secondary.So last_level_billed is updated.In claims table new status=6 is stored.For the second case the denial reason code is stored in claims table with new status=7 and in billing table with bill_process=7.We changed in billing table so that a denial search can be done in the billing manager.We would like you to review the code.Signed-off-by: Paul Simon <paul@zhservices.com>

Multiple improvements from IPPF related to layouts. (#1081)* Multiple improvements from IPPF related to layouts.A summary of what's new:o Layout groups may be nested i.e. each group can have sub-groups.o Layouts and their groups have properties that may be edited in the layout editor.o Encounter LBFs may specify sections for direct entry of services products and diagnoses.o "Case Management" feature including the ability to link encounter forms to issues  and in the issue window a tab for each related encounter form.o New layout edit option to specify initially-open groups.o Implemented design-time ACO for LBF encounter forms.o Improved printing of encounter LBFs.o Feature to print a demographics profile with data filled in for a specified patient.o Improvements to printed referrals.o Provider attribute and selector for LBF encounter forms.o New layout field type for a single checkbox.o Support for demographics/history values in LBF static text fields.o Auto-delete of shared attributes not used by any other form when a form is deleted.o Assorted layout editor improvements.o Added "Save and Continue" button to LBF visit forms.o Added sorting to export of lists and layouts.o Condition tests in LBF fields now support setting a value instead of just skipping the field.o Added field condition support to demographics and history.o Assorted bug fixes.

for pertinent AMC information at various place.   -Controlled by a global in Administration->Globals->CDR.
